author: Sofía Benavides
title: ¿Por qué Rusia no participa en los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024?
text:
(CNN) -- El Comité Olímpico Internacional (COI) decidió en octumbre de 2023 suspender la participación en los Juegos Olímpicos de París que están a punto de comenzar al Comité Olímpico Ruso, lo que implicó la pérdida de financiamiento y el hecho de que el COI se reserva el derecho de decidir sobre la participación de atletas con pasaporte ruso en tanto deportistas neutrales.
¿Por qué el Comité Olímpico Internacional suspendió a Rusia?
Tras la invasión rusa de Ucrania —apoyada por Belarús— en febrero de 2022, el COI recomendó que se prohibiera a los atletas rusos y bielorrusos competir en eventos deportivos internacionales. En enero de 2023, el COI anunció su intención de permitir que estos atletas compitan como neutrales, de forma similar a cómo se presentan los tenistas rusos y bielorrusos en otros eventos deportivos como ATP, WTA y Grand Slam, sin ninguna referencia a su nacionalidad.
Luego, sin embargo, el COI suspendió por completo al Comité Olímpico Ruso en octubre de 2023, debido a que Rusia había absorvido a las organizaciones deportivas regionales ucranianas en Donetsk, Jersón, Luhansk y Zaporiyia.
Calendario de los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024: horarios, competiciones y fechas
"La decisión unilateral adoptada por el Comité Olímpico Ruso el 5 de octubre de 2023 de incluir entre sus miembros a las organizaciones deportivas regionales que están bajo la autoridad del Comité Olímpico Nacional (CON) de Ucrania (a saber, Donetsk, Jersón, Luhansk y Zaporiyia) constituye una violación de la Carta Olímpica porque viola la integridad territorial del CON de Ucrania, reconocida por el COI de conformidad con la Carta Olímpica", afirma el COI sobre el episodio de octubre.
Pese a esa dura decisión, la comisión ejecutiva del COI dictaminó que sería injusto castigar a los atletas basándose únicamente en sus pasaportes, lo que abrió la posibilidad de permitir que algunos compitan en París, aunque bajo condiciones muy estrictas.
Mariya Lasitskene, del Comité Olímpico de Rusia, ganó la medalla de oro en salto de altura femenino en los Juegos Olímpicos de Tokio. (Noticias de Kyodo/Getty Images)
"Sin bandera, himno, ni colores"
Un "Atleta Neutral Individual" es el nombre utilizado para referirse a los atletas con pasaporte ruso o bielorruso que competirán en los juegos de este año. Se hace referencia a estos atletas con la abreviatura AIN, que proviene de la traducción francesa Athlètes Individuels Neutres.
¿Qué significa AIN en los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024?
A estos atletas se les permitirá competir siempre y cuando cumplan con los requisitos de elegibilidad.
"Las sanciones contra los responsables de la guerra, los Estados y gobiernos de Rusia y Belarús, siguen vigentes para los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024", afirmó el COI en un comunicado.
"No se exhibirá ninguna bandera, ni se cantará el himno, ni se mostrarán colores ni ninguna otra identificación de Rusia o Belarús en los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024, en ninguna sede oficial ni en ninguna función oficial", continúa el comunicado.
La vestimenta de competición de los AIN aún no ha sido revelada, por lo que no está claro si llevarán los colores turquesa de la flamante bandera de los AIN, o si vestirán ropa deportiva básica. También se ha encargado un himno, sin letra, para su uso en ceremonias de entrega de medallas.
Aunque los AIN son elegibles para competir y ganar medallas olímpicas, no figurarán en el medallero de las naciones.
Los AIN también serán excluidos del desfile de delegaciones en la Ceremonia de Apertura por ser atletas individuales y no un equipo, aunque el COI ha dicho que "se les brindará la oportunidad de vivir el evento".
La versión final de la bandera de AIN asignada por el COI el 19 de marzo. (COI)
Cuáles son los requisitos para competir como AIN
En diciembre de 2023, la Junta Ejecutiva del COI decidió que los atletas rusos y bielorrusos que se clasificaron a través de los sistemas de clasificación existentes de las federaciones internacionales tendrían que cumplir requisitos estrictos para ser seleccionados como AIN.
No habrá representación rusa ni bielorrusa en las pruebas por equipos y la participación se limitará a la competencia individual.
Según el COI, los atletas que apoyen activamente la guerra o que estén contratados por el ejército o las agencias de seguridad nacional rusas o bielorrusas no serán elegibles para inscribirse ni competir. La misma estipulación se aplica al personal de soporte.
Como todos los demás atletas, los AIN deberán cumplir requisitos antidopaje para ser considerados para la selección.
La elegibilidad de estos atletas será determinada por el recientemente establecido Panel de Revisión de Elegibilidad de Atletas Neutrales Individuales.
En los Juegos Olímpicos de Tokio 2020 (aplazados hasta 2021 debido a la pandemia de covid-19) y en los Juegos Olímpicos de Invierno de 2022 en Beijing, los atletas rusos compitieron bajo el nombre del Comité Olímpico Ruso (ROC) como resultado de un dopaje patrocinado por el Estado.
Cuántos AIN competirán en los Juegos Olímpicos de París 2024
El COI afirmó que, hasta el 28 de marzo, 12 AIN con pasaporte ruso y siete AIN con pasaporte bielorruso se habían clasificado para París 2024. "El número máximo, que es poco probable que se alcance, sería 55 y 28 respectivamente", dijo el COI a CNN.
En comparación, Rusia envió 330 atletas a Tokio en 2021, mientras que Belarús envió 104.
También está la cuestión de si Moscú aceptará realmente las condiciones establecidas por el COI. Es que Rusia planea organizar sus propios "Juegos de la Amistad" a finales de este año, un evento que ha sido condenado por el COI.
La identidad de los atletas aún no se ha revelado, pero es posible que el exnúmero 1 del mundo, el tenista ruso Daniil Medvedev, forme parte del campo. El excampeón del US Open dijo que estaría feliz de participar como un actor neutral.
"Decidí por mí mismo que siempre que pueda participar en los Juegos Olímpicos, quiero estar allí y quiero representar lo que pueda representar", dijo a los periodistas el mes pasado. "Si no es bajo la bandera, (igual) sé quién soy, sé por qué juego tenis y jugué así toda mi vida".
Con información de Sam Joseph, de CNN
The-CNN-Wire

author: ZB
title: Thunderstorms, hail threaten NZ with 'unusually cool' days ahead
text:
- Severe storms could lash the centre of the country around
[Marlborough](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/marlborough/)and[Wellington](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/wellington/)today. - MetService attributes the unsettled weather to cooling upper atmosphere temperatures and a low-pressure system.
- Niwa forecasts a cool start to January, with a warm-up expected in the latter half of the month.
Thunderstorms and hail accompanied by localised downpours are possible for large parts the country today.
[MetService](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/metservice/29/) says there’s a risk severe thunderstorms could lash the centre of the country around [Marlborough](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/metservice/29/) and [Wellington ](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/metservice/29/)from this afternoon.
Lightning and heavy rain were also possible for [Auckland](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/auckland/), [Northland](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/northland/), western [Waikato](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/waikato-news/), [Taranaki](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/taranaki/), [Wellington](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/wellington/) and [Hawke’s Bay](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/), along with [Nelson](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/nelson/), [Tasman](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/tasman-district/), the [West Coast](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/west-coast/) and North [Canterbury](https://www.nzherald.co.nz/topic/canterbury/).
For Auckland, MetService forecasts possibly heavy showers in the morning and again at night. The daily high was expected to reach 23C.
MetService said thunderstorms could hit Christchurch in the afternoon and Wellington City in the evening.
Showers in the City of Sails tomorrow morning should clear and bring in fine conditions with a high of 22C. The first day MetService has forecast without any rain is Monday.
The national forecaster said the unsettled weather today is brought by cooling temperatures in the upper atmosphere and a low-pressure system spreading over the country.
“Tolaga Bay, Tairāwhiti Gisborne is the pick for holiday weather, with sunshine, northwest breezes and a high of 26C (just a chance of an afternoon shower),” MetService said.
The National Institute of Water and Atmospheric Research (Niwa), meanwhile, has forecast “a decidedly cool lean” for the first half of January.
“After a profoundly warm December with dozens of locations observing record or near record warmth ... guidance favours more unusually cool days than warm ones to about mid-month,” the institute said.
Niwa said early signs point to a “warm-up” for the latter half of the month.
Niwa also released a forecast of weekly rainfall anomalies for each week of January, showing which parts of the country will likely see more or less rainfall than normally recorded in a week.
The projection showed Southland, Otago, the West Coast, Nelson, Taranaki, Bay of Plenty, Coromandel, Auckland and Northland could see less rain than typical for the first two weeks, Niwa said.
Higher-than-usual rainfall rates were tipped for Canterbury, eastern parts of the Wellington region and Hawke’s Bay for the first two weeks, Niwa said.
In the last two weeks of January, the Coromandel, Auckland and Northland joined the areas projected to see more rainfall than is typical for those weeks.
Raphael Franks is an Auckland-based reporter who covers breaking news. He joined the Herald as a Te Rito cadet in 2022.

author: Spencer Kimball, CNBC
title: U.S. Steel ceases trading on the NYSE as Japan's Nippon finalizes takeover - NewsBreak
text:
U.S. Steel ceases trading on the NYSE as Japan’s Nippon finalizes takeover
By Spencer Kimball, CNBC,
1 hours agoU.S. Steel shares stopped trading on the New York Stock Exchange on Wednesday after Japan’s Nippon Steel completed its acquisition of the iconic American industrial name. President Donald Trump has insisted for weeks that the companies would form a “partnership” in which U.S. Steel would remain American-owned.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->mergers and acquisitions

author: Decatur Daily Democrat
title: Mavemall Revolutionizes the iPad Experience with the Long-standing Swift 360 Keyboard Case | News | decaturdailydemocrat.com
text: Swift 360 Keyboard by MaveMall, a prominent name in the technology accessories industry, continues to rank amongst the best iPad keyboards in the world even years after its launch. Swift 360 Keyboard is a revolutionary product set to redefine standards in the iPad accessory domain. The widely popular keyboard brings unprecedented functionality, converting the iPad into an exceptionally versatile device. Amidst a competitive market, Swift 360 distinguishes itself with a distinctive blend of features and design. Setting it apart from counterparts like the Apple Magic Keyboard and Logitech Combo Touch, the Swift 360 Keyboard boasts its own built-in battery, guaranteeing consistent performance and greater efficiency. It also features adjustable backlit keys available in seven colors, providing adaptability for users in different lighting environments. A significant advantage of the Swift 360 Keyboard is its built-in battery, offering independence from the iPad's power and thus extended usability, a feature that Apple's and Logitech's models lack as they draw power directly from the iPad. Furthermore, the Swift 360 enhances user experience with its customizable backlit keys, offering seven color options to suit various preferences and lighting conditions, a level of personalization not found in the relatively static backlighting of the other two. The Apple Magic Keyboard is known for its unique floating design, and the Logitech Combo Touch has a keyboard you can detach and a stand you can adjust. However, the Swift 360 is special because it can rotate fully, giving users more ways to view and use it. This makes the Swift 360 more than just a keyboard; it's a versatile tool that improves how lots of different people use their iPads. Additions like the integrated Apple Pencil holder and extensive iPad protection highlight the keyboard's considerate and comprehensive design approach. Founded in 2021, MaveMall quickly expanded from a small home office into a successful online store with customers worldwide. "The Swift 360 represents the pinnacle of our intensive research and our commitment to crafting products that truly enhance the lives of our customers. Our growth shows our dedication to keep creating quality products," said Nick from MaveMall. As a company deeply committed to its customers, MaveMall continues to seek creative ways to enhance its offerings. "We're not just selling products; we're enriching experiences," Nick added. Join the revolution and elevate your iPad experience with MaveMall's latest innovation. The Swift 360 Keyboard is available for purchase. https://themavemall.com/collections/ipad-cases/products/rotatable-ipad-keyboard-case Media Contact Company Name: MaveMall Contact Person: Nick Email: Send Email City: London Country: United Kingdom Website: themavemall.com/

author: CRA News Service
title: Workforce Diversity Still Lags in High-Tech | ChannelE2E
text: [SC Media](https://www.scmagazine.com/news/percentage-of-women-minorities-in-tech-workforce-unchanged-since-2005) reports that the high-tech industry continues to lag in women, Black and Hispanic workers even after 20 years of efforts toward strengthening diversity in the sector. Even though women accounted for nearly half of the total U.S. workforce, they were only 22.6% of the high-tech workforce, which is unchanged from two decades ago, while fewer than 20% were in higher-paying positions within the sector, according to a report from the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission. The findings also showed that the percentage of Black workers within the field only slightly increased from 6% in 2005 to 7.4% in 2022. On the other hand, Hispanic workers accounted for less than 10% of the industry's workforce despite representing almost 20% of the total U.S. workforce. "Reexamining and revising education and training requirements for cybersecurity roles is a great place to start. For example, many organizations still prioritize traditional qualifications such as four-year degrees, however, more than 90% of our survey respondents say that candidates with cybersecurity certifications stand out," said Fortinet Vice President of Global Training and Technical Field Enablement Rob Rashotte.

author: , The Detroit News
title: Storms flood Metro Detroit roadways, more rain likely
text: Flooding creates issues across Metro Detroit roadways, communities Heavy storms caused headaches across parts of Wayne County and southern Macomb County on Friday, flooding streets, highways and basements. A flash flood advisory was in place most of Friday for southwestern Macomb County and northeastern Wayne County, including cities such as Detroit, Eastpointe, Center Line, Grosse Pointe Woods, Hamtramck, Harper Woods, Highland Park, Roseville, St., Clair Shores, and Warren. City officials in some southern Macomb County communities spent all day Friday addressing flooding issues, from towing 19 cars stuck in water on one roadway to dealing with calls from residents about flooded basements. Warren Mayor Lori Stone said "torrential" rainfall hit the city, starting late Thursday night and spilling into Friday. The city's south end received approximately 2 inches of rainfall in about one hour, while at least 3 inches of rain fell within one hour in the north end, she said. "This storm inundated the City’s infrastructure which, like most 70-year-old infrastructure, was only designed to accommodate rain events of 2 inches or less," said Stone in a statement late Friday. She said city officials from multiple departments including public works, sanitation, police and fire were working to address flooding concerns. She said the city's sanitation workers planned to pick waste from flooded homes Saturday. Flooding also shut down several highways early Friday, including part of the Southfield Freeway in Wayne County, Interstate 696 at 11 Mile and at Interstate 94 at 12 Mile in Macomb County. In Clinton Township, Hayes Road between Clinton River Road and Utica Road and Millar Road between Utica Road and Garfield Road in Clinton Township also were closed due to flooding. And Hoover Road south of 12 Mile also sustained heavy flooding, said Stone; 19 vehicles had to be towed. The National Weather Service said an estimated two inches to three inches of rain fell over the region. And meteorologists with the service predicted scattered to numerous thunderstorms would come later Friday, dropping another 1 inch to 2 inches of rain on the region by Saturday morning. "These storms are not likely to be severe, but heavy rainfall rates may cause localized minor flooding, especially across urban, low-lying and flood-prone areas," the weather service said. For homeowners in part of Warren, Roseville and St. Clair Shores, the latest dousing of rain meant flooded basements. Many residents posted pictures on social media of flooded basements. One local basement cleanup company said it had received multiple calls about flooded basements in Warren. "We have our teams out pumping out water & running air movers & fans," posted Trash Bully's Dumpsters & Home Improvement on Facebook. St. Clair Shores officials on Friday said their staff worked through the night Friday to address flooding that resulted from heavy and intense rainfall. "Our Public Works crews are working to remedy flooded streets and aid our residents," said the city in a statement. Power outages Most of Michigan's power company customers Friday had not lost service in the storms. DTE Energy said only about 3,400 of its more than 2.2 million customers were without electricity Friday. Consumers Energy reported about 1,000 of its customers were in the dark while the other 99.9 percent did not have their service interrupted. Freeway accident The flooding played a role in an accident on the Southfield Freeway early Friday morning. A 33-year-old man, driving a Lincoln at a high rate of speed, struck an MDOT Courtesy Patrol car around 2:25 a.m. on M-39 South and Grand River Avenue as Michigan State Police and MDOT officials were blocking off the freeway for flooding, MSP Second District stated in an X post. MSP had been ramping off traffic at Grand River, while officials placed hazard cones and patrol cars with emergency lights to block to freeway when the accident happened, according to the X post. No one was hurt. The driver showed signs of alcohol impairment and registered at three times the legal blood alcohol content limit of 0.08 percent, First Lt. Mike Shaw told The News. Troopers arrested the driver and took him to the Detroit Detention Center. “We are very fortunate that no one was hurt in this crash.” Shaw said in the X post. “This is another example of the preventable crashes we are seeing due to risky driving behaviors on our roadways.” Forecast The humid weather is expected to persist through Saturday, the weather service said. The heat index is expected to reach near 90 both days, it said. Relief is on the way, though, as a cold front is expected to move through the region Sunday night/Monday, officials said. Staff Writer Marnie Munoz contributed. cramirez@detroitnews.com X: @CharlesERamirez

author: 小浪财讯
title: 卫星产业ETF（159218）跌2.68%，成交额2880.61万元_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
8月14日，招商中证卫星产业ETF（159218）收盘跌2.68%，成交额2880.61万元。
卫星产业ETF（159218）成立于2025年5月14日，基金全称为招商中证卫星产业交易型开放式指数证券投资基金，基金简称为招商中证卫星产业ETF。该基金管理费率每年0.50%，托管费率每年0.10%。卫星产业ETF（159218）业绩比较基准为中证卫星产业指数收益率。
规模方面，截止8月13日，卫星产业ETF（159218）最新份额为4961.64万份，最新规模为5918.74万元。
流动性方面，截止8月14日，卫星产业ETF（159218）近20个交易日累计成交金额2.52亿元，日均成交金额1257.53万元。
卫星产业ETF（159218）现任基金经理为许荣漫。许荣漫自2025年5月14日管理（或拟管理）该基金，任职期内收益19.29%。
最新定期报告显示，卫星产业ETF（159218）重仓股包括 中国卫星 、 中国卫通 、 航天电子 、 中科星图 、 华测导航 、 移远通信 、 北方导航 、 北斗星通 、 铂力特 、 海格通信 ，持仓占比如下。 股票代码 股票名称 持仓占比 持仓股数（股） 持仓市值（元） 600118 中国卫星 1.66% 12.93万 341.35万 601698 中国卫通 1.30% 13.85万 266.89万 600879 航天电子 1.27% 28.87万 259.83万 688568 中科星图 1.05% 3.87万 214.66万 300627 华测导航 0.97% 4.67万 199.13万 603236 移远通信 0.95% 2.60万 195.05万 600435 北方导航 0.83% 14.97万 170.06万 002151 北斗星通 0.79% 6.17万 162.09万 688333 铂力特 0.73% 2.38万 150.36万 002465 海格通信 0.72% 14.11万 147.31万

author: Chris Kerr
title: UK video game expo WASD is dead
text:
Trending
Opinion: How will Project 2025 impact game developers?
The Heritage Foundation's manifesto for the possible next administration could do great harm to many, including large portions of the game development community.
UK game expo WASD has been canceled after its organizer entered liquidation. The BBC shared the news this morning and spoke with co-founder David Lilley who confirmed the event had become unsustainable.
"Increasing costs and less demand for stand space means running events is just not viable for us anymore," said Lilley. WASD launched in 2022 in a bid to replace the EGX Razzed indie showcased.
The London event focused on spotlighting smaller creators in tandem with larger releases. Rumors of WASD's demise began to spread earlier this year when its website went offline shortly after the 2024 event took place.
Speaking to the BBC, Lilley said he understood how important WASD had become for indies and thanked them for their support.
The news comes with the wider video game industry in disarray. [Layoffs and studio closures have carved through the industry in 2024](https://www.gamedeveloper.com/keyword/layoffs), with major players like Microsoft, Sony, Embracer, EA, Take-Two and others choosing to cancel projects, shutter or divest teams, and enact layoff-laden restructuring plans that have left thousands of developers grappling with debilitating uncertainty.
You May Also Like

author: Keeley Milne
title: 3 weird ways to break out of your post-holiday slump
text:
3 weird ways to break out of your post-holiday slump
Brain puzzles, Instagram stories and running roulette: you'll feel revitalized after you tackle any of these unique training sessions
Mystery route roulette
Turn your run into an adventure, letting chance guide your path. Write down a few of your favourite local
running routes and distances on pieces of paper, throw them into a hat, and draw one before a run. The element of surprise will inject some excitement into your run while making the outing a unique exploration.
Run-doku challenge
Combine the brain-teasing challenge of Sudoku with a
fantastic fartlek workout. Before your run, solve a Sudoku puzzle (there are lots of beginner ones online). Choose one of the nine grids on the Sudoku puzzle to use as inspiration for your training session.
As you run, follow the Sudoku pattern and change your pace or focus based on the corresponding numbers. Sprint during “5” segments, jog during “2” segments, and so on. This creative twist adds a mental aspect to your run, making it a dynamic and entertaining challenge.
Instagrammable running challenge
Tap into
your creative side by turning your run into an Instagram scavenger hunt—bonus points if you can rope some friends into competing against you (or running with you). Set a goal to find and photograph specific items during your run—a red door, a street sign with your name on it, a specific model of car, a maple tree, a pickup truck with a snowplow on the front, someone wearing a pink hat, or even a friendly neighborhood cat.
Sharing your unique finds on social media can transform your run into a fun visual story to look back on for inspiration whenever you don’t feel like putting on your shoes.
